pengu.database

Class MessageDBCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • pengu.database.PenguAccessDBCommunicator
      • pengu.database.MessageDBCommunicator

  • public class MessageDBCommunicator
extends PenguAccessDBCommunicator
    This class provides the methods required for message related database transactions.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class pengu.database.PenguAccessDBCommunicator

        dbAddress

      Adds a In-box/Message reference to the In-box table
      int addReceivedMessage(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String message, int messageReference)
      Adds a received message into the Received Messages table and creates a chat with the user if one has not been created yet.

      Adds a sent message to the Sent Messages database and places it on the Out-box table.

      Creates a new Chat with the specified user.

      Deletes a In-box/Message Reference from the In-box table as it has been downloaded from the server.

      Fetches the ChatID from the Active Chats database for the corresponding User ID.

    • Method Detail

      • createNewChat

        public int createNewChat(java.lang.String username)
        Creates a new Chat with the specified user.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user to which create the new chat must be created.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • getChatDetails

        public java.sql.ResultSet getChatDetails(int userID)
        Fetches the ChatID from the Active Chats database for the corresponding User ID.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the User to which the chat belongs.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing column "ChatID".

      • getForcedChatID

        public int getForcedChatID(java.lang.String username)
        Fetches the ChatID form the Active Chat database for the specified user, and creates a new chat if one has not been created already.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user.
        Returns:
        Returns the ChatID as an integer.

      • addSentMessage

        public int addSentMessage(int chatID,
                          java.lang.String messageContent,
                          int publicKeyID)
        Adds a sent message to the Sent Messages database and places it on the Out-box table.
        Parameters:
        chatID - The ID of the Chat to which the message belongs.
        messageContent - The text of the message.
        publicKeyID - The ID of the public Key to be used when encrypting the message.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • markMessageAsSent

        public int markMessageAsSent(int outID)
        Marks the out-box record as sent.
        Parameters:
        outID - The ID of the out-box record.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • getMessagesToSend

        public java.sql.ResultSet getMessagesToSend()
        Fetches a list of Messages that need to be sent from the out-box table.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns: "MessageContent", "Recipient", "PublicKeyString", and "OutID".

      • addMessageInboxReference

        public int addMessageInboxReference(int messageReference,
                                    java.lang.String senderUsername)
        Adds a In-box/Message reference to the In-box table
        Parameters:
        messageReference - The integer reference received from the server.
        senderUsername - The String representation of the username of the sender to which the reference belongs.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • messageReferenceExists

        public boolean messageReferenceExists(int messageReference)
        Checks if the specified message reference exists.
        Parameters:
        messageReference - The message reference of the in-box record.
        Returns:
        Returns TRUE if the message reference exists, else FALSE.

      • getUndownloadedMessages

        public java.sql.ResultSet getUndownloadedMessages()
        Fetches message references from the In-box table that have not yet been used to download a message.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns: "MessageReference" and "SenderUsername".

      • getDownloadedMessageReferences

        public java.sql.ResultSet getDownloadedMessageReferences()
        Fetches a list of Downloaded message references to skip the process of adding them.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns: "MessageReference" and "SenderUsername".

      • deleteSentMessage

        public int deleteSentMessage(int sentMessageID)
        Deletes a Sent Message From the database.
        Parameters:
        sentMessageID - The ID of the Sent Message.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • deleteReceivedMessage

        public int deleteReceivedMessage(int receivedMessageID)
        Deletes a Received Message From the database.
        Parameters:
        receivedMessageID - The ID of the Received Message.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • getListOfChats

        public java.sql.ResultSet getListOfChats()
        Fetches a list of the active chats from the Active Chats Database.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns "Username", "DisplayName", "HEXColourCode" (the contact group color code), "NamingConvention" (the contact group naming convention) and LastMessageSeen.

      • getSentMessagesFromChat

        public java.sql.ResultSet getSentMessagesFromChat(int chatID)
        Fetches a list of Sent Messages from the Sent Messages database for the specified chat.
        Parameters:
        chatID - The ID of the Chat.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns "ChatID", "MessageContent", "DeliveryStatus", "ReadStatus", "DateDelivered", "DateRead", "PublicKeyID", and "DateSent".

      • getLastSentMessageFromChat

        public java.sql.ResultSet getLastSentMessageFromChat(int chatID)
        Fetches the last sent message from a specified chat.
        Parameters:
        chatID - The ID of the chat.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet with columns: "ChatID", "MessageContent", "DeliveryStatus", "ReadStatus", "DateDelivered", "DateRead", "PublicKeyID", "DateSent", and "SMessageID".

      • getReceivedMessagesFromChat

        public java.sql.ResultSet getReceivedMessagesFromChat(int chatID)
        Fetches a list of Received Messages from the Sent Messages database for the specified chat.
        Parameters:
        chatID - The ID of the Chat.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns "ChatID", "MessageContent", "DateReceived".

      • getLastReceivedMessageFromChat

        public java.sql.ResultSet getLastReceivedMessageFromChat(int chatID)
        Fetches the last received message from a specified chat.
        Parameters:
        chatID - The ID of the chat.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet with columns: "ChatID", "MessageContent", "PublicKeyID", "DateReceived", and "RMessageID".

        Deletes the specified chat from the active chats table.
        Parameters:
        chatID - The ID of the chat.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

                          java.util.Date readDate)
        Sets the status of a sent message to 'Read'.
        Parameters:
        sentMessageID - The ID of the sent message.
        readDate - The Date the message was read.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • setMessageDelivered

        public int setMessageDelivered(int sentMessageID,
                               java.util.Date deliveredDate)
        Sets the status of a sent message to 'Delivered'.
        Parameters:
        sentMessageID - The ID of the sent message.
        deliveredDate - The delivery date of the send message.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • getUserChatID

        public int getUserChatID(java.lang.String username)
        Fetches the ID of the Chat with a specified user.
        Parameters:
        username - The Username of the user.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer containing the "ChatID", if no "ChatID" exists with the specified user -1 is returned.

      • addReceivedMessage

        public int addReceivedMessage(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              int messageReference)
        Adds a received message into the Received Messages table and creates a chat with the user if one has not been created yet. This method also marks the in-box reference to downloaded so the message is not downloaded again.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the Message sender.
        message - The text of the message.
        messageReference - The message reference of the message.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer - the ID of the Received message.

      • markFailedDecryptionAsDownloaded

        public int markFailedDecryptionAsDownloaded(int messageReference)
        Marks a specified in-box record as Downloaded, as the private key required to decrypt it can not be found.
        Parameters:
        messageReference - The message reference for the in-box record.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.

      • getMessageInboxReferences

        public java.sql.ResultSet getMessageInboxReferences()
        Fetches a ResultSet containing In-box/Message References that need to be downloaded.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet with columns: "InID", "MessageReference", and "SenderUsername".

      • deleteMessageInboxReference

        public int deleteMessageInboxReference(int inID)
        Deletes a In-box/Message Reference from the In-box table as it has been downloaded from the server.
        Parameters:
        inID - The ID of the In-box/Message Reference
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of the number of affected rows.
